forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely before 4am. Mostly cloudy. Low around 43, with temperatures rising to around 45 overnight. East southeast wind 5 to 8 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely after 10am. Partly sunny. High near 55, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. East northeast wind 1 to 12 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the evening settles over Downtown San Francisco, a soft veil of moisture envelops the city. The air carries the crystalline chill of approaching rain, while the streets glisten faintly with the glow of streetlights, reflecting the muted gray of the clouds gathering above. Tonight's forecast hints at a potential sprinkle before dawn, the chance of precipitation dancing around 60%. Residents can expect temperatures to hover around the chilly high 40s as the east-southeast breezes whisper through the alleys.

On Wednesday, the city awakens to a day that promises a mix of partly sunny moments, shadowed by the likelihood of rain later on. The high will reach the mid-50s, with temperatures gently descending as the hours pass. An undertone of anticipation lingers in the air, suggesting that an umbrella might soon become both a shield and a companion, as a 70% chance of rain lurks on the horizon. It’s a time for cozy layers—perhaps a light rain jacket paired with something warmer underneath, as the marine layer brews its familiar dance with the coastal winds. A stroll through the quieter streets may be just the antidote to the midweek humdrum, a chance to enjoy a warm drink at a local café or perhaps take in a gallery displaying the city’s artistic soul, as clouds blanket the horizon in shades of deep gray.
